, but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:â Northeastern India , Bangladesh , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and western Malesia .

Distribution:â Central Myanmar , Thailand and western Malesia .

LOCALITY. Imp., without collector s.n. ( W-R 41245 & 41247). Reported from Sagaing and Magway regions by
Kress et al. (2003: 74)
, but we have not seen material from these areas
.
Distribution:â Northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand and Vietnam .

Dendrobium parishii Rchb.
f., Bot. Zeitung (Berlin) 21: 237, 1863. Type :â MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Parish 18
( holotype : K)

(Rchb.f.) Kuntze,

(Rchb.f.) Kuntze,

f.
var. dives Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron ., n.s., 26: 205, 1886. Type:âORIGIN UNKNOWN (? Myanmar ). Cult. Bull s.n. ( holotype : W-R).

Dendrobium polyphlebium Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron ., ser. 3, 1: 702, 1887. Type :â MYANMAR . Mon State : Mawlamyine District ,
Berkeley s.n.
( holotype : W).

Dendrobium polyphlebium Rchb.
f.
var. emericii Rchb.
f., Gard. Chron ., ser. 3, 2: 242, 1887. Type :âORIGIN UNKNOWN (? Myanmar ). Imp. Berkeley s.n. (not located).

Specimens examined:â ? MYANMAR . Types . UPPER MYANMAR . Berkeley s.n. (not located), fide Grant (1895: 110). KACHIN . Mohnyin District: 175 m , 6 May 2010 , Kurzweil & Saw Lwin KL 2815 , photo; Bhamo District: Foerstermann s.n. (W-R 7583). SAGAING . Kale District: fide
Aung et al. (2020: 81)
. CHIN . District not traced: 610 m , comm. 9 Oct 1923 , Daun 4 (K); Mindat District: fide
Aung et al. (2020: 81)
. MANDALAY . Pyinoolwin District: 1065 m , without collector 13560 (K); Myingyan District: Khin Myo Htwe 7 (TNS [s]), fide
Tanaka et al. (2015: 77)
; same loc., Khin Myo Htwe 30 (TNS [s]), fide
Tanaka et al. (2015: 77)
. MON. Mawlamyine District: types ; same loc., Parish 376 (not located), fide Parish (1883: 193 ; as
D. rhodopterygium
); same loc., 1874, 1875, Parish s.n. (W-R 20943). Reported from Shan State and Tanintharyi Region by
Kress et al. (2003: 74â75
; as
D. rhodopterygium
), but we have not seen material from these areas.
Distribution:â The eastern Himalayas, northeastern India , Myanmar , Thailand , Indochina and southwestern China .

Notes:â W-R 20946 is possibly the type of
D. rhodopterygium
, and W-R 20955 is possibly the type of
D. polyphlebium .
More study needs to be made of these two entities. Reichenbach may have been right: they are hybrid taxa. A photograph by Nyan Tun (2014: 231) labelled as
D. rhodopterygium
resembles a hybrid between
D. aphyllum
and
D. parishii .
